question:
The term Commercial Paper was recently making news with respect to the IL &FS crisis. Consider the following statements about the Commercial Paper:
  1. It is an unsecured money market instrument
  2. Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) and Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) are not allowed to invest in commercial paper
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: First statement is correct because commercial paper is an unsecured money market instrument issued in the form of promissory notes. Corporates, primary dealers (PDs) and the All-India Financial Institutions (FIs) are eligible to issue CP. Second statement is incorrect because Individuals, banking companies, other corporate bodies (registered or incorporated in India) and unincorporated bodies, Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) and Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) etc. can invest in CPs.
